casebody.data:
Harry S. Wright, Appellee, v. THE Steamtug EDWARD CHILTON, Marine Transit Corporation, Appellee; THE Steamtug LIBERTY, Respondent-Impleaded, Benjamin J. Cowles, Appellant. No. 267. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. March 10, 1930. Stanley & Gidley, of Buffalo, N. Y. (Ray M. Stanley, of Buffalo, N. Y., of counsel), for appellant. William F. Purdy and John E. Purdy, both of New York City, for appellee the Edward Chilton.

Before L. HAND, AUGUSTUS N. HAND, and CHASE; Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree [27 F.(2d) 624] affirmed.
